name: Downwell
description: Downwell is a curious game about a young person venturing down a well in search of untold treasures with only his Gunboots to protect him.
minimum_requirements: 最低配置: 操作系统: Windows 7 or later 内存: 1 GB RAM DirectX 版本: 10 存储空间: 需要 200 MB 可用空间 附注事项: Controller recommended.

reviews.review_text: Pros:  perfect level of challenge   easy to pick up, hard to master   great powerup and health system   ♥♥♥♥ing gunboots   cheap   neat enemy design past area 1   very fun boss fight with a few bullet hell aspects   huge replay value   large number of palletes to choose from   shopkeeper   Cons:   bats   a good portion of the palletes are hard on the eyes   often times whether you'll do well or not is determined by luck, such as getting the right upgrade choices   bats   also, bats, the scum of the earth   A very fun game with an almost perfect challenge level, I'd definitely recommend you pick it up for a few dollars 8.5/10

Downwell was an interesting purchase on iOS, so I thought to buy it again on Steam. After all, PC master race. Of course, playing on PC is far better than playing on iOS, where a majority of deaths can be blamed on the ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ touchscreen! Downwell for the PC is the game in its full, worth-trying-to-complete glory. The mechanics are ingenious, though the enemy design is lacking. Several critics called it their favorite of 2015, so I would recommend it for the $3.

Very good first impressions so far.   Controls are tight, I love the visuals, and the difficulty is just right (not easy enough to steamroll through every level, not cheaply difficulty either.)   For the price, it's totally worth it if you enjoy games like Nuclear Throne.

After playing about 3 or so hours of the game I can firmly say that my experience was rather enjoyable. The idea of only being able to shoot down while falling mechanic is different when it comes to a rogue-like of game, it is an easy concept to grasp but tricky to master. There being many unlocks like screen filters and several character types really gives it some replayability. I find the game delivers for its price point and is a must pick up if you're into rogue-like games and 2D shooters.   Pros: Game is affordable and have replayability with achievements and unlocks.   Cons: Some pickups are super OP while another will insure a swift GG. Some enemies tend to swarm you in a goldilock zone where you are not able to dodge no matter what and must take damage, mostly getting cornered in doorways. Some combinations of upgrades can sometimes cause you to free fall in a situation where it is not called for due to chain reactions occurring in unison.   In conclusion I give the game a 8/10, you get a lot of fun for the price ;).
help ive fallen and i cant get up

I actually just bought this game yesterday thinking I would play it for a half hour and lay it to rest. Bought it because it was cheap but it's surprisingly addictive. The controls are simple, move, jump, and shoot. Where it gets more complex is the power-ups. You get gun upgrades as you travel down the well and power-ups at the end of each stage. Stages gradually get more dificult and add more elements the further you go down. I've only reached the third area so far but everytime I die it gives me more of a push to see if I can do better. The more you play the more you can unlock too, different game shaders, as well as different styles you can use to fight baddies. Overall, pretty happy with this one.

What's not to say that hasn't already been said?  Great arcade-style game, progression, color palette choices, falling and fighting styles and the endless drop of the well!  Easy to pickup, hard to master but one great game and within 30 mins I've already unlocked a style and 4 palettes. Had I realized there were caves, powerups and shops (lmao) on my first few run-through's I would have likely done better but.. Meh, whatever!  Great game for me and yes I can already tell by 30 mins it will be one I can pickup between a call, work, whatnot and just have some falling goodness!

Entertaining, cheap game that's easy to pick up and play if you're ever bored one afternoon. Only game in which burst weapons are actually good. Hasn't ever crashed on me. (Surprising since I game on a Mac. Lol.) 8/10

Though the gameplay is based on one deceptively simple mechanic (the jump button, which becomes the button to shoot your gunboots while in mid-air), Downwell offers multiple layers of complexity through frenetic action in randomly-generated stages. Randomized upgrades at the end of each stage and in mid-stage shops and side rooms will be familiar to Binding of Isaac veterans; this adds some strategy to your character build and becomes necessary as later stages increase in difficulty.  This is a fantastic game well worth the asking price. On sale this is a no-brainer of a purchase.

I can't believe I put this one off for so long. It feels very satisfying on the controls and mistakes feel like your own fault.  It's basic, but entertaining. Hails back to certain things in Metroid, and can have you wondering what the next area's like.   You can unlock different rulesets which also alter your run animation for a bit of fun as well as different game rules.

I can’t find much wrong with a game that at base price is a cheap pick up, and is enjoyable for it’s short sessions. Don’t mistake short sessions for non rewarding gameplay, because Downwell is entertaining and fun to play. There is enough here for people looking for a small time diversion and more for those wanting to invest in a challenge.   Pros  • Plenty there for people looking for short gameplay sessions. Enough there for people looking for a challenge • Cheap • Easy to learn gameplay with simple mechanics and controls • Short game sessions  • Short levels adds variety, rewards, and keeps your game time interesting • Simple graphic style and colour scheme help in signifying gameplay basics. Helps in the overall pickup and play approach of the game    Cons  • Some pick ups and weapons don’t add much to your base game • Visual clutter takes a few play throughs to get used to  • Some runs can leave you feel a little unsatisfied with random pick ups. So is the curse of the rogue-lite genre

A very simple and addicting game, at a fantastic price point to boot. It controls very well and can handle bite sized to extended play sessions in between other stuff. You'll honestly know just by watching 5 mintues of gameplay if this is right for you, and if you decide it is, pick it up and enjoy.
This game is an absolute blast to play. I love the customization! (Especially, and ironicly, the Virtual Boy palette)

Amazingly tight gameplay with simple play concepts. The visuals and sound effects work well with the gameplay (not neccessarily a selling point however). There may not be as much depth to Downwell as some other action games, but the game is so well designed ANY fan of action video games should get some enjoyment out of this title.
SImple but fantastic, this game is simply about falling down a level killing enemy's, getting gems, and getting upgrades. It's amazing and simple.
Very fun game. Easy to learn, very hard to get good at.

It may seem like a simple game that you could toss away seconds after playing, but its randomized levels and powerups, combo system, unique gunboot mechanic, unlockables, and aesthetics give it a depth unprecedented for most quickplay games like this.  Oh yeah, and it's only 3 dollars usually. I believe it is completely worth that and a little more.

Game: Downwell Price: 2.99(I got it on sale)  I say that downwell is a pretty darn good game. It can get really addicting and has quite a few rewards. You can get styles. Some styles are just used to change your look, but some may increase health or options. You can also get palettes which change the color of the screen. At the end of every level, you get a powerup to help you.  Pros: Fun Retro Cheap Great for all people Palettes Fun to watch yourself get better  Cons: Difficult, but its ok(its the point too) Bats Snails Crawlers THE FREAKING EYEBALLS   You can see that the game is good already.  Gameplay: 10/10 Soundtrack: 10/10 Replayability: 10/10 Graphics: 10/10. Retro always gets a 10

Super fun game. It is extremely addictive, full of content, and extremely cheap. There are many palletes, styles, and upgrades to choose from, as well as different modes, PROGRESSION, and more! Seriously, this is super good. It is worth your time and money.   Thats all. 10/10.
Downwell oozes good game design. I really mean that. Downwell is a leaky roof, a bursting pustule, a slippery slug, a runny nose, an unwashed bunghole. Let the good game design ooze forth.

Fantastic gameplay, fast paced, difficult, with a lot of thought put into it. An amazing game. The only thing I'd say the game lacks, is the reason to go for a high combo, as the rewards only go to 25.
Excellent game! I couldn't stop playing until I got all the achievements!

Sidescrollers have always been great. It's a well-known formula for challenge and fun. Now here comes Downwell making a 90 degree turn to bring you a 'downscroller'. It's addictive as it is satisfying, challenging your reflexes and decision making at every jump.   You control a little dude with gunboots which allows you to fend off the enemies. There are various upgrades to choose from and shops. The levels are generated randomly (afaik) within their own theme which adds to the variety and challenge (for example catacombs 1 doesn't look exactly the same twice in a row). You collect gems as means of currency and also to be able to unlock new modes and color palettes.   In summary, I can say this game is a fun, addictive downscroller and at 3e it's a steal.
Simple little arcade style game. Nice to see something innovative and yet so simple.
sick game REAL fun also great to play when your torrents are downloading. gr8 buy. (£0.99 in steam sale :D)  also i love the puncher gun

'DOWNWELL' is a game where you are some guy sleeping outside near a giant well and you have to jump down and use your gunboots to blast away evil creatures who don't like you in their home.        Pros   Cons       Good Music   No Multiplayer       Additcing Gameplay   No Badges       Nonstop Action   No Dlcs'       8-bit   No Parkour       Fun Acheivments   Short Game       Muliable Guns   N/A       Power-Ups   N/A       Fun To Speedrun   N/A
this is better than spelunky

Downwell is single-handedly the best game I have ever played. I have owned it for about 6 hours, and I have not put it down for about 6 hours either. The music is fire, the mechanics, which appear simple at first, are damn near ecstasy, especially as you unlock the new styles and work on a survival plan, and the art is fantastic. On top of that, the quiet and strange mythos keeps you awkwardly wondering what business a kid with guns for footwear has in a well which apparently leads to purgatory. I love this game.
Hard game but this game is very good!!!

A arcade, rogue-like, bullet hell, item collecting pixel game. With a difficulty level that is punishing if u make the wrong move. I can't pass area 1 becuase keep dying from those motherf***ing bats...Great soundtrack and gameplay though!   Love it 10/10 would reccomend, especially since its $2.99
What a great little game! Fun gameplay, neat premise (gunboots baby!), fantastic replayability. Highly recommended. And if you somehow don't like it, you're only out like 3 bucks.
Difficult, yet accessible. This might be the best game in it's price range.

One of the best and most naturally free-flowing action games I've ever had the pleasure of playing. More than worth your time and money to enjoy mastering this beautiful platformer. Genuinely fantastic art and soundtrack too.
why lie. Reviewing for badges

While new to the game and only a couple of hours in I feel as though this little GEM ( I'm so sorry ) is worth talking about. TL;DR version: -Tons of nifty nostalgic unlocks. -Great dedication to the theme of an arcade quarter ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ / handheld platformer from the late 80's/early 90's. -Extremely fast and rewarding gameplay. -Lots of character in a little package. -Super addictive (Also the word 'M U N C H E R' is censored by steam?! 0.o Wut?)  Downwell is as the description calls it: 'A curious game'. Taking Rogue-like elements and mashing them into a precision, skill based 'platformer' is a really neat idea. One of which results in very addictive gameplay.  In the vain of Super House of Dead Ninja's; the game is given to you in bite sized chunks. Testing you in on-the-fly problem solving through its very fast bouncing mechanic. Which is extremely rewarding. Granting the player bonus gems ( currency/points ), health boosts and just an awesome feeling of accomplishment. I won't bother going to far into to detail as the game is fairly self explanatory based on the trailer video within the store front. I will say that while very easy to pick up, it is an extremely skill based and deep game. One that offers a very nice skill curve that I myself am still exploring.  Much like S.H.o.D.N/ Luftrausers; the game is brimming with highly addictive replayablity for arcade and rogue-like junkies. Also: It's ♥♥♥♥ing $2.99. Skip buying an energy drink or pack of gum and pick it up.
I ♥♥♥♥ing hate this piece of ♥♥♥♥
Difficult, yet accessible. This might be the best game in it's price range.

Cool little game that's also released for iOS that you can waste hours on. I've enjoyed my time on it. The whole strategy of the game is that you want to fall to the bottom without hitting the enemies. There are platforms while you are falling, but there are also enemies. You can stomp on certain enemies to kill them (like Goombas). You also have a gun which shoots bullet below you, stopping your fall and letting you get your bearings.  I bought this for 1.99 and have certainly gotten my money's worth. At 2.99, it's kind of an iffy buy, as most people I assume will play just a few hours of it. It's certainly difficult (not Super Hexagon difficult) though and you will probably take awhile to beat all four stages of the game (I've got about 10 hours or so on my game and I've yet to win the game.)  There is also a hard mode for once you beat the entire game. I assume it will cause you to bleed in real life.
This game is so siplistix but it is challenging and very unique

At only $3, if you like shooty games that require a gamepad, JUST BUY IT. (It'll play with keyboard, but if you like this kind of game you've already got a gamepad, and it's much better that way.)  A non-obvious comparison here is Risk of Rain. Like that game it's pretty damn hard, and you can expect to die a lot, but it's exhilarating, and the longer you play it the better it gets. They're both easy to pick up the basics, but harder to master. As you play more you'll go farther partly because you unlock new things (play styles here) but mostly just because you got better. And that's exhilarating!  So much shooty explodey fun! And a complete steal at $3. No-brainer.
Yes. This. Game. Is.  RAD.  HELP.  I. Can't. Stop.    It's. Fun!

You really can't go wrong when the User Review Rating is Overwhelmingly Positive.  You also can't go wrong with a Devolver title.  Like everyone else has said here, Downwell is a very solid, easy to pick up, hard to put down, impossible to survive 8bit action platform shooter.  Easiest way to describe it is your little 8 bit dude is falling down a well filled with enemies. You only have two controls: jump and shoot, all controlled with the same button, so you'll either be using the directional pad of your controller, jumping, or shooting. When you shoot, your fall is slowed down until you run out of ammo, but your dude will reload after you either land on a rock or platform or stomp an enemy. You'll also collect gems as you destroy rocks and kill enemies, and you can use these gems in shops on the way down to get better gun upgrades or refill your HP. Each level concludes with you reaching the water at the bottom of the well. The wells get deeper and take longer to complete the higher levels you reach.  It's a rogue-like, so you'll keep playing and progressing until you die, then it's back to level 1. It will take your gems and give you a progress bar. Once it's filled, you'll unlock different colors for your screen as well as styles of play.   You'll die a lot when you first start because you'll think you have the game figured out and you so don't. You're not just falling and shooting stuff. There IS strategy involved, it's not just dumb luck.  My suggestions are these: TAKE YOUR TIME. It's not a race to the bottom. You want to stay alive as much as possible. Also, know your enemies. Some of them you HAVE to shoot in order to kill and others can be stomped on the head. Those little dudes scaling the sides of the walls with the spikey backs..SHOOT THEM. Those birds can be a nuisance too, so blow them away when you get the chance and don't linger because they will chase you and take a nice bite out of your HP.  Know your guns. Not every gun is as effective. While some are really powerful, they have a very short 'magazine', so if you're spamming it all the way down, you'll be empty more times than not. My personal favorites so far are Burst (B), Shotgun (S), Fist (F), and Machine Gun (M). Laser (L) is my least favorite.  Pick your post-level upgrades wisely. You can drastically change your survivability by choosing the right one. Giving yourself extra HP is fine, but not if you're not doing as much damage as you could. You'll just take slightly longer to die. The Droid is a great upgrade for clearing rocks and enemies as you fall. I usually grab that and couple it with Triple (T). I also like the upgrade that reloads your gun as you collect gems. The less I have to think about reloading the better. I'm trying to get to the bottom of the well with as much HP left as possible. The right combo of gun and upgrade can make all the difference.   Don't try to kill every enemy. Remember, your goal is to stay alive, collect gems, and reach the end of the level, not clear the well of all enemies. Some enemies you will seriously need to ignore and keep moving down. If they get persistent, THEN dispatch them, but you're gonna gain gems regardless, so don't waste time trying to kill everything, lest you put yourself at risk of dying early. You can fall faster than they can chase you, so destroy what's in your way and bypass what is not.  Have fun! This is another great game from Devolver!  9/10
THIS IS FUN! I just want to keep playing but I really need to leave otherwise I'll be late for work.  >:(

Thanks, Jim Sterling. I'm a sucker for any sort of rogue-like (because that isn't obvious from looking at the number of hours I've played The Binding of Isaac: Rebirth). The style of this game is entirely different from Isaac, and has that same replayability. I love trying to get combos. I'm not very good at the game yet, but I've only been playing for an hour. I'll definitely end up putting several more into the game.
Rogue-like, check. Platformer, check. This is fun simple game when looking for something to jump into and out of. Love the price enjoying the game.
Satisfying and hard as balls.

Haven't been this excited for a retro action rogue-lite in a LONG time.  For 3 bucks, you can't beat it. This game has enough content and enjoyment for any casual action platform enthusiast. Pick this up now!

The best experience you'll ever have jumping down a well while wearing gunboots.  Really challenging and really fun. Great soundtrack and smooth gameplay with excellent replayability. The visual style is incredibly retro but still comes off clear and with a good interface. Could use some story and maybe some settings to make it a tad easier for those who aren't into big challenges.  Also it's like 3 USD so there's no excuse not to try.
Amazing little game. Less than Pastie, best £2 ive spent in ages.

This game is phenomenal. For the asking price, it is definitely worth the £2 I paid for it. While I haven't played a lot of the game and I am sure there is still tons of stuff I haven't seen, I can certainly say this game is worth every penny. Every now and then I re-open this game to play just a game or two and hope I can go further than before. This game is tough, but it's not impossible. With skill and caution it is possible to go deeper and deeper but it won't be easy. Overall, I would rate this game a 9/10.

The best experience you'll ever have jumping down a well while wearing gunboots.  Really challenging and really fun. Great soundtrack and smooth gameplay with excellent replayability. The visual style is incredibly retro but still comes off clear and with a good interface. Could use some story and maybe some settings to make it a tad easier for those who aren't into big challenges.  Also it's like 3 USD so there's no excuse not to try.

The only thing I didn't like was that there wasn't more items. Good game, hard, but good.
Great Game! This game is on mobile, and I played it a couple times. This Game Is Awesome, and cool. If you like platform speedrunning games, this is the game for you!
TFW 3 colours had better graphics than some triple A games
Excellent arcade style action game. Feels great playing it in tate mode with an arcade stick!
A fantastic classic-style platformer. I can't recommend it enough.
Falling down a well probably shouldn't be this much fun. Well worth the money.
Very challenging unique little arcade style platformer. There's tons of depth packed into this simple little game.

I received this as a gift, though I did have my eye on it. Yes, I've only played for less than half an hour. Yes, I am ready to wholeheartedly recommend this game.  It is a fast paced, simplistically beautiful arcade game that does exactly what it sets out to do. It's a fall-n-gun platformer that knows how to make things clear. For instance, it is quite obvious which enemies are stompable and which aren't by the color scheme, and the controls are simple and elegant and immediately clear.  The only opaqueness is the weapon system, and that quickly becomes clear (you learn fast that S is shotgun and L is laser and what that means, for instance)  Highly recommended

Downwell is awesome. It has cool style, fun gameplay with interesting powerups and an addictive combo system that constantly has me wanting to play one more run. For less than a cup of coffee this game is a great value, and I'd reccomend it to anyone who enjoys arcade style platformers.
Incredible excecution on a simple concept, one of my favorite games in a long time.

Downwell is a 2d, retro style, rogue-lite, action platformer, with noticeable inspirations from Vlambeer. The game conceptually plays like the offspring of Super House of Dead Ninjas and Luftrausers; a game about fluidity, speed, reflexes and screenshake. Lots of screen shake.  Your goal is to perpetually move downwards, through a procedurally generated well, killing or avoiding enemies, collecting gems and weapon upgrades, before making it to the end of the stage. At the end of each stage, you are rewarded with a choice of perks/abilities; think Nuclear Throne.  The main joy in this game comes from the superbly fluid controls, allowing for instinctive, twitch platforming. All good platformers are defined by their movement mechanics, and this game has really nailed it. Couple this with the game's brilliantly nostalgic art style and soundtrack, and you have a real indie gem.  Downwell may not be everyones cup of tea, but for fans of the genre, this is an amazing game, at a steal of a price.
This game is $3 and hella fun, what more do you need?
The ending is literally the most amazing thing. 10/10.
Am I good at this game? No. Do I still think it's amazing? Yes.
Just... look at my hours played. This game is really good. 10/10

Why don't you own this game yet? eh. Replayability over 9000, gonna get me them boots for the next time I have a blocked sink, blows all sorts away. Speccy and Gameboy style graphics for the win.
This game is ♥♥♥♥ing great!
Bought the game. Installed the game. Sunk 42 minutes into the game. Had to quit the game to contain rage. 10/10.

really cool game. Very simple. Fall down and shoot enemies. It's really fast paced and controls really well and feels good to do it right. It's a really good game for short bursts, might even be better to play it on your phone if you'd rather. I enjoy it on the PC tho.   Only downside is that there are some pretty unexplained mechanics in here that I had to kind of look up myself. Example being, getting a combo of 25 + will heal you 1 and increase your charge by 1 so it's better to just end your combo at 25 for the most part. Also when you're at max HP, if you get a healing item it fills up another smaller bar beneath it and if you do it 4 times it increases your max HP.   Other than that, it's very worth it at the price. Plays well. looks good, very short.

Downwell is that game you buy for a dollar and play for about 10 minutes.  Then you get bored of your 60$ games and play this over and over, even though you haven't even gotten to the first boss.   EDIT: Misnamed the game first time

Downwell is a mix of clunky controls mixed with extremely precise requirements and poor visibility, which don't fit well together because of how little room for error the game allows.  But it's cheap, and has solid gameplay for those who want a game like this, so I can't say.

An absolute blast to play. Great assortment of enemies to keep you on your toes, upgrades all add their own twist, completely changing the gameplay in some cases. I highly recommend everyone play this at least once, that's all it takes to get hooked.

Feels like a good old Gameboy game but how long it takes to get to the end depends on how well you do since there's no saves and you only get set amounts of health (which you can upgrade as well as your ammo). The music is awesome and the controls are simple, getting big combos is fun and it refills your health. The laser is the best gun. There's lots of palettes to unlock and you can choose different styles. I have yet to try hard mode but the boulder style is the one I have used most, arm spin style is cool too.
Very fun and cool! Would reccomend ign 10/10 too much chicken
Well put together game. Its a nifty wee rogue-like with a steep learning curve and rewarding gameplay.
An utterly fantastic 2D indie platformer that will keep you wanting to play 'just one more time'.
It's 3 dollars. If you have a soul, you will enjoy the platforming and excellent gameplay mechanics.   Buy it for your soul.
A cool game with a nice concept and addictive gameplay for 3$ is an awesome deal

This game is pure and simple fun. Downwell is a game about falling down a well with gunboots strapped to your feet. There are four normal worlds, and a fifth world with a final boss. That might seem like a formula for a short game.  You are sorely mistaken.  In Downwell, you will die repeatedly, and you will probably rage quit too. But this game is too satisfying, too addicting, too fun to put down.   This game is a rogue-lite; a roguelike without all of the complexities normally associated with the genre. The levels are randomly generated, making no two playthrough the same. There are five playstyles, a harder difficulty mode, and 32 color palettes to unlock, with a custom palette maker on the way soon.  As of this review, I still haven't beaten the game. If you want to know more about the game, watch the trailer, and buy it for yourself! It's really cheap and you won't regret it!
People sometimes say that a game is stylish. They should be saying that that game is vaguely Downwell-ish.
The damn frogs.
It's like doodle jump except it's actually good.
Never knew going Down-a-Well could be so fun

Saw this as a new Steam game when it was released day one. The description of the game sounded interesting and was craving for an arcade fix. The thing that made the game truly shine is it's frantic way of beating levels. You're going down a well with gunboots. Smashing and shooting your way through bricks and scoring gems. Also, the levels are procedurally generated so of course you will see the layout of the level of bricks, powerups, and enemies placed at random parts of the well when playing through each level. So far the game has a nice replay value if you did include the randomization of level generation and highscore leaderboards.  The price is a downright steal for such a unique arcade game and this being a debut of 23-year-old Ojiro Fumoto is a rather impressive game for such an awesome price. I beg of you dev if you can improve this awesome formula you have concocted I would pay you a significant amount of money. If any of you have not picked it up yet I suggest you do so now. It plays fine with a keyboard if you do not have a game controller. Game pad or not the controls are rather simple and satisfying.  Pick it up! You will not regret it.

looks at downwell, thinks 'meh, but its only three bucks, and besides there are still steam refunds.' gets downwell, plays it and thinks, 'THIS WAS ONLY THREE DOLLARS?! HOW?!' seriously, its only three bucks for a game i could play infinite times for infinte days, in infinite ways.

Gameplay os fast pased, power ups are influential ad fun to use, aestetics are minimal but pleasing to look at, music is pretty good, controlls are tight as they can be. 8/10 would recomend if into 'arcade style' platformers. It's also fairly challenging and uses random dungeon generation, memorization is impossible, need to improve reflexes if you want to get further.

With Downwell, you get a whole lot more than what you pay for. An instant classic that I can see myself playing at an arcade for hours on end. The game's simple appearence is so charismatic. The music and sounds added to the environment as I found myself trying to fall deeper and deeper. The game accelerates your pace in each area but does it in such a smooth way, you barely notice the transition. Of course, as long as you don't panic. Even as I type this I am readying myself to back and play again.  On the surface, simple. No context, just down. In reality, I died in area three, didn't expect what I found. 10/10 would swim again.
I fall, I jump, I shoot, i die. Nothing else you need in life. Oh and there are rice balls
Shmup + rogue like = 10/10, would go down again
Like my friend said, 'It's fun.'

I haven't played for long but thats ok, cuz you dont need to. this game is all short bursts. considering the ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t hp pool you get and the dumb enemy design will leave you with rage. hit boxs are strict and while falling at 100000000000 mph down a hole the game expects you to notice very small monsters that CANNOT be stomped on. you MUST shoot some mobs while others can be stomped on but others demand it. Like i said some mobs can be stomped on, cool right? goomba style. No, if u even slightly touch the SIDE of the mob you will get hurt also the underbelly but thats understandable. and you only have 4 hp ( can be up'd by upgrades ) so unless you're used to unfair gameplay and fast-paced games you WILL have a hard time getting to floor 3-5 and don't get me started on the complete ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t this games throws at you during the new floors. like ♥♥♥♥ING SPIKE FLOORS!!!. Eventhough this game is legit only 3 buttons it' hard. harder than tostitos chip that have been left in the cold outdoors for 2 days. music is decent, pretty annoying at somepoints, sounds are okay aswell, visuals are nothing to right home about but i do like them, monster design is questionable, and im assuming the floors are RNG created so thats cool i guess, no patterns you can remember. The character movement is nice but i feel like the game is half in control by putting monsters right next to you and the rate at which you fall is barely controlable with limited hover. some old dude can offer you pointless upgrades like rice balls that recover hp and whatnot that can help but not by much. Overall i would give this game a 8.5/10. its nice but not perfect at all ( of course, what game is? ). for the price it ask for, it's worth it. go ahed and buy it.....just..don't take the game too seriously.

This game is unexpectedly brilliant and you won't spend long figuring out how well it does its job.  The idea behind the game is simple, you jump down a well and attempt to fall to the bottom of it using your gun boots to kill and stomp enemies as you fall. You pick up currency you can spend on consumable items and power ups at shops. When you finish a level you gain a power up, similar to what happens when you finish a level in nuclear throne. All the levels are procedurally generated and each world has its own enemies and nuances. Games start fast, go fast, and end fast with a few unlocks as part of a overarching reward scheme. So, it's kind of like a rogue-like where you fall down and see how far down you can go.  Finding bad things to say about the game is hard, the controls are as tight as a NES era console game, there's a jump button, a shoot button, and you can go left or right as you fall. I'd recommend a controller to play. Your gun boots reload as you hit some floor or solid object. The power ups are meaningful and change the way you approach encounters as you fall down the well. The graphical design is old, Atari old, the color consists of a black-color grayscale palate where you can change the 'color' as an option. It doesn't detract from the game and I feel the gameplay more than makes up for what you get, particularly as cheap as you can get this game for.  I really can not think of a sort of gamer who wouldn't enjoy this simple game. The mechanics are solid, it's cheap, the playthroughs are fast paced and fun, it appeals to casuals looking for a quick playthrough and hardcores looking to break the game. In short, it does everything a good game should do.
Stomp everything, buy stuff, DIE.
Feel like your feet don't touch the groooooound
This game is too addictive and is ruining my life. 9/10 recommended.

I feel very bad for giving a negative review for this game. On the surface it has everuthing I want in indie title: simple yet elegant visuals, simple controls and short play sessions that you can do over again and again. And it is fun and dynamic and fluid, but it just gets so boring after a while. Weapons, perks and powerups just don't provide enough variety.

Cons:  The keyboard controlls will kill the entire game if you don't own a controller.  Pros:  Loads of weapons Rouglike level and pickup generation Hugely addictive A mobile game with no microtransactions A nuclear throne-esq power up system A pretty balloon Lots of colour pallets (all but one are sh!t) 5 (ish) 'styles' to play as It costs less than lunch Good controlls (providing you use a controller)   Conclusion:  If you have a controller, Downwell is a must-buy, if you don't, get a conroller for God's sake and then buy Downwell.
love this game go play it
I love you, Downwell
Remember being a kid at an arcade? Remember how machines would ask for two tokens to play, and some games you would just keep pumping them in until your cup was empty?  This is such a game.

A quick, downward-oriented, roguelike indie game. Wew, what a mouthful.   This game is one of those 'easy-to-learn, difficult-to-master' situations.   You make your way down a spooky well filled with all sorts of creatures that I assume are trying to eat you in order to... reach the bottom. Heh. You could probably finish the game easy enough just by winging it but I feel like most of the fun and challenge lies in making those sicknastyhuge combos (I think my highest combo was around 215-ish).  Collect gems from enemies and safe rooms, then purchase health refills/expansions, or more weapon charges. If you collect a lot of gems quickly this also gets you a 'gem high' which significantly buffs your weaponry. Choose from about a dozen different perks each time you complete a level. Mix and match them for crazy bullet explodey times. It's all good.  On that note you've got a respectable amount of weapons to choose from, but you'll probably just stick to a few you feel most comfortable with (shotgun and puncher for me).  Finally, where the game falls short in length it makes up for in replayability, easily worth the price they're asking I think ($2.99 AUD, full price at the time of this review). With that said, I got all the achievements in about 2 hours so I'm pretty much done with it. Your own play times may vary.  Simple mechanics but solid gameplay. Short though. 5/10.

Downwell is a platformer where you descend down a well with gunboats that will only shoot directly below you. As you descend the well the enemies will get tougher and more complex as will the levels in general. This game does not like to explain things to you. It wants you to figure everything out on your own, and it makes for a delightful experience of discovery and wonder when you find something new. This game is great for times when you only have 20 minutes before you have to go do something so you don't want to get involved in another game. Also the game is ♥♥♥♥ing $3. That is an incredible price for the amount of enjoyment I have gotten out of this game.Downwell is a really solid game, but I don't want to talk about it too much as I think this is a game that is better when you experience it for yourself. So why don't you just trust me on this one ;D

Downwell is hard. I don't tend to like hard games, but I do like Downwell. For about $4 AUD this game is a bargain. Whenever I don't know what to play on Steam, Downwell draws me in. You'll probably play the game in quick bursts and die often. I can't even get past the cavern levels. The constant dying might wear you down but the game keeps you invested by awarding points at the end of each run which go into a progression bar which unlocks new play dynamics and new palettes. Downwell is simple in its execution and a very tight experience. Downwell does what it needs to do and does it perfectly.

Downwell is my kind of game. The pacing is excellent, the artstyle and music hit all the right notes, the procedurally generated levels are difficult enough to keep you constantly on your toes without the game's challenge level being unfair, and you have  shotgun boots . I don't want to rave over Downwell so much that it dissuades people from playing it, but seriously, it's packed so full of engaging gameplay, retro flair, and pure bang for your buck that Downwell is impossible for me not to recommend.

Downwell is a cheap little game, a shooter-platformer with very simple graphics. Absolutely recommended if you like retro platformers and shoot em ups. The world is randomly generated, so every game is different. Control is good and generally it's a very fun game! Sound effects are great, but music is forgettable.  In the game you just keep going downwards, jumping and shooting the enemies (you can also just jump on most enemies, but not all of them). In the game you can only shoot downward. So you are pretty much defenseless if the enemies attack from above or from the side. You collect new weapons and upgrades as you go. You only have a small amount of HP, so you gotta be careful. This game WILL get very difficult quickly. But it's also very addictive and makes you say 'one more game!'.  This game was suprisingly good, so any fan of retro 2D action should check it out! For this price, it's a great deal.

Downwell is a unique take on the sidescroller genre, actually it's a verticalscroller. That's because you progress through each level by dropping down a well, hence the title, Downwell. You have these gunboots allowing you to shoot enemies. Landing on platforms or stomping on enemies reloads and there are various types of weapon modules that change the way the gunboots function. The game has real tight controls allowing for precise movement and the levels are procedurally generated, so each time you play it keeps you on your toes. The game can be played at any pace and it all works. You can be patient and meticulous or you can be fast and rythmic (my preferred method). You can also play it in long strides or short bursts to pass the time.  All of these elements come together to create gaming bliss. I love this game and it's only 3 dollars. Just get it.

SImple, fun and downright challenging. I got this game while browsing the Steam page for indie game. The moment I saw the trailer I was HOOKED. An addicting rogue-like shoot-em up in the form of descending a well with gunboots, but with the nostalgia of the old handheld games, complete with the four pallette colour schemes and all.
A wonderfully contained, tight package. Everything about the game looks, sounds and plays fantastic. Arcade games don't come around like this too often.

9/10 strap a pair of guns to your boots and jump down a well shooting like crazy, this game is all about game mechanics done to perfection. The game deserves it's review title of 'overwhelmingly positive', at first glance this game seems overly simplistic and boring, why i didn't pick it up before meeting Ojiro at a game conference, not only is this game super fun, frigging well balanced, addictive as hell, the creator is an absolutely good guy, despite Downwell is inspired by Spelunky, this title will for sure set new standards in the future, i really don't have anything to put on this game, actually i want to create my own :), i hope that a version two would not only consist of even more iterations on the game mechanics but also include levels like Spelunky, the progression part would fit nicely.   do yourself a favor, despite this may not be you immediately cup of tea, do give it a try, same goes for Spelunky, they are both very solid platformer.

Downwell is a unique little retro action game where you're a guy with gunboots diving down a well, shooting monters in his path and collecting powerups. This game is quite hard as you have very little health and there's no checkpoints or saves. If you die, you restart. However as you play you accumulate points and level up, giving new gameplay styles, palletes and more. The game is procedurally generated and you will definitely die a lot on your way to the bottom. It's simple, unique, fun and I highly recommend it.

Holy ♥♥♥♥, This is one of the best games i have played in a while (no joke). you play as a humanoid blob thing equipped with a pair of gun boots descending into a pit filled with with snails and bats and turtles and spiky ♥♥♥♥. on every level you can find 3 caves filled with upgrades like health and ammunition or shops. these levels are short and sweet yet they get more challenging the further you go. for only $2.99, consider getting it, on sale? I purchased this game at a small price of around $1.00 during a sale and I must say, I don't regret a thing. Downwell is a very simple, yet fun game that possesses a substancial amount of replay value for its asking price. The game can be quite short depending on how well you adapt to the difficulty, but the addicting gameplay might make you come back for more on another run.  If you happen to have extra money lying around, I wouldn't hesitate to pick up Downwell.
